property.name: cluster.name
property.description: A cluster-based name for CDAP. It is used for scope resolution of preferences and runtime arguments. For example: the preference key "cluster.[cluster.name].my.key" would be resolved to "my.key" at runtime; a program can then retrieve the preference value by using just "my.key". The administrator can use this property to set different preferences for each cluster.

property.name: hdfs.lib.dir
property.description: Common directory in HDFS for, among others, JAR files for coprocessors

property.name: hdfs.namespace
property.description: Root directory for HDFS files written by CDAP

property.name: hdfs.user
property.description: User name for accessing HDFS

property.name: instance.name
property.description: Determines a unique identifier for a CDAP instance. It is used for providing authorization to a particular CDAP instance. Must be alphanumeric, and should not be changed after CDAP has been started. If it is changed, there is a risk of losing data (for example, authorization policies).

property.name: network.proxy.address
property.description: A SOCKS 5 proxy address for CDAP to proxy outgoing connections. The address must be in the format of "host:port".

property.name: local.data.dir
property.description: Data directory for CDAP Local Sandbox and the CDAP Master process in Distributed CDAP

property.name: mapreduce.include.custom.format.classes
property.description: Indicates whether to include custom input/output format classes in the job.jar or not; if set to true, custom format classes will be added to the job.jar and available as part of the MapReduce system classpath

property.name: mapreduce.jobclient.connect.max.retries
property.description: Indicates the maximum number of retries the JobClient will make to establish a service connection when retrieving job status and history

property.name: mapreduce.status.report.interval.seconds
property.description: Time in seconds between reporting the status, including retrieval of the job's task report, while a MapReduce program is running.

property.name: master.manage.hbase.coprocessors
property.description: Whether CDAP Master should manage HBase coprocessors. This should only be set to false if you are managing coprocessors yourself in order to support rolling HBase upgrades.

property.name: master.environment.extensions.dir
property.description: Semicolon-separated list of local directories that are scanned for CDAP Master environment providers.

property.name: master.startup.checks.classes
property.description: Comma-separated list of classnames for checks that will be run before the CDAP Master starts up. If any of the checks fails, the CDAP Master will not start up. Checks will only be run if ${master.startup.checks.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: master.startup.checks.enabled
property.description: Whether checks should be run before startup to determine if the CDAP Master can be run correctly. Which checks are run is determined by the ${master.startup.checks.packages} and ${master.startup.checks.classes} settings. If any checks fail, the CDAP Master will fail to start instead of waiting for the problem to be fixed. This setting only affects Distributed CDAP. It does not apply to CDAP Local Sandbox.

property.name: master.startup.checks.packages
property.description: Comma-separated list of packages containing checks that will be run before the CDAP Master starts up. If any of the checks fails, the CDAP Master will not start up. Checks will only be run if ${master.startup.checks.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: namespaces.dir
property.description: The sub-directory of ${hdfs.namespace} in which namespaces are stored

property.name: root.namespace
property.description: Root for this CDAP instance; used as the parent (or root) node for ZooKeeper, as the directory under which all CDAP data and metadata is stored in HDFS, and as the prefix for all HBase tables created by CDAP; must be composed of alphanumeric characters

property.name: location.cache.path
property.description: Local directory for caching remote location content

property.name: location.cache.expiration.ms
property.description: Location cache expiration time in milliseconds

property.name: thrift.max.read.buffer
property.description: Specifies the maximum read buffer size in bytes used by the Thrift service; value should be set to greater than the maximum frame sent on the RPC channel

property.name: twill.java.heap.memory.ratio
property.description: The minimum ratio of heap to non-heap memory for all launched Apache Twill containers. Container-specific settings also exist for CDAP system containers.

property.name: twill.java.reserved.memory.mb
property.description: Desired reserved non-heap memory in megabytes for all launched Apache Twill containers. The actual value is bounded by the ${twill.java.heap.memory.ratio} setting of the container memory size. Container-specific settings also exist for CDAP system containers.

property.name: twill.jvm.gc.opts
property.description: Java garbage collection options for all Apache Twill containers; "<LOG_DIR>" is the location of the log directory in the container; note that the special characters are replaced with entity equivalents so they can be included in the XML

property.name: twill.location.cache.dir
property.description: The relative directory name on the distributed file system for Apache Twill to cache generated files, to speed up launching applications. This directory is relative to ${root.namespace}/twill on the file system.

property.name: twill.no.container.timeout
property.description: Duration in milliseconds to wait for at least one container for Apache Twill runnable

property.name: twill.yarn.am.memory.mb
property.description: The memory size in megabytes of the Apache Twill application master container

property.name: twill.yarn.am.reserved.memory.mb
property.description: Desired reserved non-heap memory in megabytes for Apache Twill application master container. The actual value is bounded by the ${twill.java.heap.memory.ratio} of the ${twill.yarn.am.memory.mb} setting.

property.name: twill.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: ZooKeeper namespace prefix for Apache Twill

property.name: upgrade.thread.pool.size
property.description: Number of threads to be used running operations concurrently during a CDAP upgrade

property.name: zookeeper.client.startup.timeout.millis
property.description: Duration in milliseconds to wait for a successful connection to a server in the ZooKeeper quorum

property.name: zookeeper.quorum
property.description: ZooKeeper quorum string; specifies the ZooKeeper host:port; substitute the quorum (FQDN1:2181,FQDN2:2181,...) for the components shown here

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout.millis
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds

property.name: bootstrap.file
property.description: File that contains bootstrap steps that should be executed on a new CDAP instance as well as steps that should be executed on every restart of CDAP. Bootstrap steps include operations like loading system artifacts, creating the native profile, and creating the data prep application.

property.name: system.app.config.dir
property.description: Directory that contains definitions for what system apps should be running. This directory is continuously monitored for new/modified config files and updating application state to match what is defined in those files.

property.name: dataset.unchecked.upgrade
property.description: If false, any changes made to existing datasets are not deployed when an app is redeployed; setting this value to true allows the dataset changes to be deployed upon app redeployment

property.name: enable.unrecoverable.reset
property.description: Determines if resetting CDAP should be enabled. **WARNING: Enabling this option makes it possible to delete all applications and data; NO RECOVERY IS POSSIBLE!**

property.name: app.artifact.dir
property.description: Semicolon-separated list of local directories scanned for system artifacts to add to the artifact repository

property.name: app.bind.port
property.description: App Fabric service bind port; if 0, binds to a random port

property.name: app.output.dir
property.description: Directory where all archives are stored

property.name: app.program.extra.classpath
property.description: Additional Java classpath for CDAP programs. These extra classpaths must be present on all nodes in the cluster. Supports wildcard suffix "*" to include all JAR files under a directory.

property.name: app.program.jvm.opts
property.description: Java options for all Apache Twill containers

property.name: app.max.concurrent.runs
property.description: Maximum number of concurrent program runs allowed; set to -1 for unlimited

property.name: app.program.max.start.seconds
property.description: Maximum number of seconds to wait for a program to start before killing it

property.name: app.program.max.stop.seconds
property.description: Maximum number of seconds to wait for a program to stop before killing it

property.name: app.program.runid.corrector.interval
property.description: Interval in seconds of how often the run id corrector thread will run; this value should be greater than 0

property.name: app.program.runid.corrector.tx.batch.size
property.description: Number of run records being fetched per transaction for checking if needed for correction. This value is directly proportional to the ${data.tx.timeout} setting.

property.name: app.program.local.dataset.deleter.initial.delay
property.description: Interval in seconds for initial delay for the local dataset deletion thread; this value should be greater than 0

property.name: app.program.local.dataset.deleter.interval
property.description: Interval in seconds of how often the local dataset deletion thread will run; this value should be greater than 0

property.name: app.program.runtime.extensions.dir
property.description: Semicolon-separated list of local directories that are scanned for program runtime extensions

property.name: app.program.spark.yarn.client.rewrite.enabled
property.description: Specify whether to rewrite the YARN 'Client.scala' class in Spark to work around issue SPARK-13441 in CDH clusters

property.name: app.program.status.event.fetch.size
property.description: Maximum number of events to fetch from the messaging system in each processing cycle for program status update events

property.name: app.program.status.event.poll.delay.millis
property.description: The delay in milliseconds to check again for new program status events after it detects there was no event

property.name: app.program.yarn.attempt.failures.validity.interval
property.description: The interval in milliseconds for the time window used by YARN Resource Manager to check for application max failure attempts. By default, this is only used for long running program, but can be override through runtime argument `system.yarn.attempt.failures.validity.interval`

property.name: app.program.transaction.control
app.temp.dir
property.description: Temp directory

property.name: apps.scheduler.queue
property.description: Scheduler queue for CDAP programs and CDAP Explore queries

property.name: app.deploy.update.schedules
property.description: If true, redeploying an application will modify any schedules that currently exist for the application; if false, redeploying an application does not create any new schedules and existing schedules are neither deleted nor updated. This property only affects the redeployment of an application; all related actions or endpoints are unaffected.

property.name: master.services.bind.address
property.description: Bind address for app fabric service and dataset service

property.name: program.container.dist.jars
property.description: Additional jars to be localized to every program container and to be added to classpaths of CDAP programs. They can be local file paths on the CDAP Master or URIs of remote files. Multiple JAR files are comma- separated.

property.name: scheduler.job.queue.num.partitions
property.description: Number of partitions in the scheduler's job queue. This is the same as the number of constraint checker threads started by the scheduler.

property.name: scheduler.max.thread.pool.size
property.description: Size of the scheduler thread pool

property.name: scheduler.misfire.threshold.ms
property.description: The number of milliseconds by which a schedule execution can miss its next-fire-time and still run

property.name: scheduler.event.poll.delay.millis
property.description: The delay in milliseconds that the scheduler checks again for new events after it detects there was no event

property.name: scheduler.time.event.fetch.size
property.description: Maximum number of events to fetch from the messaging system in each processing cycle for time schedule events

property.name: scheduler.stream.size.event.fetch.size
property.description: Maximum number of events to fetch from the messaging system in each processing cycle for stream size schedule events

property.name: scheduler.data.event.fetch.size
property.description: Maximum number of events to fetch from the messaging system in each processing cycle for data schedule events

property.name: scheduler.program.status.event.fetch.size
property.description: Maximum number of events to fetch from the messaging system in each processing cycle for program status schedule events

property.name: time.event.topic
property.description: Topic name for publishing time events from time scheduler to the messaging system

property.name: program.status.event.topic
property.description: Topic name for publishing status transitioning events of program runs to the messaging system

property.name: program.status.record.event.topic
property.description: Topic name for publishing program status recording events to the messaging system

property.name: workflow.token.max.size.mb
property.description: Maximum allowed size in megabytes of a workflow token; if the workflow token exceeds this size, no further updates are allowed

property.name: requirements.datasetTypes.exclude.list
property.description: Comma separated list of plugin datset type requirements that cannot be met in the instance. Plugins that require any of these will be treated as if they don't exist. For example, if 'table' is given, any plugin that requires 'table' will be treated as if they don't exist.

property.name: ui.theme.file
property.description: File containing the theme to be used in UI

property.name: audit.enabled
property.description: Determines whether to publish audit messages

property.name: audit.publish.timeout.ms
property.description: Audit message publishing timeout in milliseconds

property.name: audit.topic
property.description: Topic name used to publish audit messages in the messaging system

property.name: data.local.storage
property.description: Database directory for LevelDB, used for data fabric in CDAP Local Sandbox

property.name: data.local.storage.blocksize
property.description: Block size in bytes for data fabric when in CDAP Local Sandbox

property.name: data.local.storage.cachesize
property.description: Cache size in bytes for data fabric when in CDAP Local Sandbox

property.name: data.event.topic
property.description: Topic name for publishing data events to the messaging system

property.name: data.storage.implementation
property.description: The database implementation CDAP will use.

property.name: data.storage.sql.jdbc.driver.external
property.description: Indicates whether the JDBC driver has to be loaded from an external directory. If true, then the JDBC driver directory has to be specified using "data.storage.sql.jdbc.driver.directory". If false, then the JDBC driver is present in the CDAP classpath. This config can only be used when the storage implementation is postgresql.

property.name: data.storage.sql.jdbc.driver.directory
property.description: The base directory for storing JDBC driver jars. Sub-directory with the name that matches with the value of "data.storage.implementation" setting will be searched for the corresponding JDBC driver and dependencies jars to connect to the configured sql instance. The JDBC driver class to load has to be specified using "data.storage.sql.jdbc.driver.name". This config can only be used when the storage implementation is postgresql.

property.name: data.storage.sql.jdbc.driver.name
property.description: The jdbc driver class name to connect to the sql instance. The jdbc url, username, password, connection properties can be set using cdap-security.xml.

property.name: data.storage.sql.jdbc.connection.url
property.description: The jdbc url to connect to the sql instance. No sensitive information should be provided using the jdbc url. The username and password can be specified in cdap-security.xml. For non-sensitive properties, it can be specified by adding a property with name prefixed with "data.storage.sql.jdbc.property.", followed by the sql property name.

property.name: data.storage.sql.jdbc.connection.pool.size
property.description: The max number of connections for the sql connection pool.

property.name: data.tx.enabled
property.description: Determines if the transaction service is enabled.

property.name: data.tx.bind.address
property.description: Transaction service bind address

property.name: data.tx.bind.port
property.description: Transaction service bind port; if 0, binds to a random port

property.name: data.tx.changeset.count.limit
data.tx.changeset.count.warn.threshold
property.description: Soft limit for the number of entries in a transaction's change set; if exceeded, a warning is logged.

property.name: data.tx.changeset.size.limit
data.tx.changeset.size.warn.threshold
property.description: Soft limit for the aggregate size in bytes of a transaction's change set; if exceeded, a warning is logged.

property.name: data.tx.client.count
property.description: The number of pooled instances of the transaction client; increase this to increase transaction concurrency

property.name: data.tx.client.provider
property.description: Provider strategy for transaction clients; valid values are "pool" and "thread-local"

property.name: data.tx.discovery.service.name
property.description: Name in discovery service for the transaction service

property.name: data.tx.grace.period
property.description: Time in seconds used to pad transaction maximum lifetime while pruning

property.name: data.tx.hdfs.user
property.description: User name for accessing HDFS (if not running in secure HDFS)

property.name: data.tx.janitor.enable
property.description: Determines if the TransactionDataJanitor coprocessor is enabled on tables; normally should be true

property.name: data.tx.max.instances
property.description: Maximum number of transaction service instances. Increasing the number of transaction service instances only improves availability, but not scalability

property.name: data.tx.max.timeout
property.description: The limit for the allowed transaction timeout, in seconds. Attempts to start a transaction with a longer timeout will fail.

property.name: data.tx.memory.mb
property.description: Memory in megabytes for each transaction service instance

property.name: data.tx.num.cores
property.description: Number of virtual cores for the transaction service

property.name: data.tx.num.instances
property.description: Requested number of transaction service instances

property.name: data.tx.prune.enable
property.description: Enable invalid transaction list pruning

property.name: data.tx.prune.plugins
property.description: List of transaction pruning plugins; for CDAP HBase tables that use transaction functionality to skip or clean invalid data

property.name: data.tx.prune.state.table
property.description: Table used to store intermediate state when invalid transaction list pruning is enabled

property.name: data.tx.pruning.plugin.class
property.description: Class name for the default transaction pruning plugin

property.name: data.tx.retain.client.id
property.description: Whether and how long to retain the client id of a transaction. Valid values are: "off" to disable retention of the client id; "active" to retain the client id until a transaction is committed; or "committed" to retain the client id as long as its change set participates in conflict detection. Retaining the client id slightly increases the memory footprint of the transaction service. Client ids are never retained past a restart or fail-over of the transaction manager.

property.name: data.tx.server.io.threads
property.description: Number of IO threads for the transaction service

property.name: data.tx.server.threads
property.description: Number of threads for the transaction service

property.name: data.tx.snapshot.codecs
property.description: Specifies the class names of all supported transaction state codecs

property.name: data.tx.snapshot.dir
property.description: Directory in HDFS used to store snapshots and logs of transaction state

property.name: data.tx.snapshot.interval
property.description: Frequency of transaction snapshots in seconds

property.name: data.tx.snapshot.local.dir
property.description: Storage directory on the local filesystem of snapshot and logs of transaction state when in CDAP Local Sandbox

property.name: data.tx.snapshot.retain
property.description: Number of transaction snapshot files to retain as backups

property.name: data.tx.thrift.max.read.buffer
property.description: Maximum read buffer size in bytes used by the transaction service; the value should be set to something greater than the maximum frame sent on the RPC channel

property.name: data.tx.timeout
property.description: Timeout value in seconds for a transaction; if the transaction is not finished in that time, it is marked invalid

property.name: dataset.data.dir
property.description: Base directory for user data on the filesystem

property.name: dataset.executor.bind.address
property.description: Dataset executor HTTP service bind address

property.name: dataset.executor.bind.port
property.description: Dataset executor bind port; if 0, binds to a random port

property.name: dataset.executor.container.instances
property.description: Number of dataset executor instances

property.name: dataset.executor.container.memory.mb
property.description: Memory in megabytes for each dataset executor instance

property.name: dataset.executor.container.num.cores
property.description: Number of virtual cores for each dataset executor instance

property.name: dataset.executor.max.instances
property.description: Maximum number of dataset executor instances

property.name: dataset.extensions.dir
property.description: Directory where all dataset extensions are stored

property.name: dataset.service.bind.port
property.description: Dataset service bind port; if 0, binds to a random port

property.name: dataset.service.boss.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service boss threads for the dataset service

property.name: dataset.service.connection.backlog
property.description: Maximum connection backlog of the dataset service

property.name: dataset.service.exec.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service executor threads for the dataset service

property.name: dataset.service.output.dir
property.description: Directory where all dataset modules archives are stored

property.name: dataset.service.worker.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service worker threads for the dataset service

property.name: dataset.table.prefix
property.description: Prefix for dataset table name

property.name: explore.active.operation.timeout.secs
property.description: Timeout value in seconds for an SQL operation whose result was not fetched completely

property.name: explore.cleanup.job.schedule.secs
property.description: Interval in seconds to schedule the clean-up of timed-out operations

property.name: explore.container.yarn.app.classpath.first
property.description: Determines if the YARN application classpath precedes the query engine classpath

property.name: explore.enabled
property.description: Determines if the CDAP Explore Service (ad-hoc SQL queries) is enabled

property.name: explore.executor.container.memory.mb
property.description: Memory in megabytes for each CDAP Explore executor instance. This is explicitly set differently than ${master.service.memory.mb} as Explore requires more memory to run than the CDAP Master service.

property.name: explore.executor.container.num.cores
property.description: Number of virtual cores for each CDAP Explore executor instance

property.name: explore.http.timeout
property.description: The timeout in seconds for HTTP requests to the CDAP Explore service. Because requests may happen within a transaction, it is recommended to keep this timeout noticeably shorter than the default transaction timeout, ${data.tx.timeout}.

property.name: explore.inactive.operation.timeout.secs
property.description: Timeout value in seconds for an SQL operation which does not have any more results to be fetched

property.name: explore.local.data.dir
property.description: Data directory for the CDAP Explore service when in CDAP Local Sandbox

property.name: explore.service.bind.port
property.description: CDAP Explore service bind port; if 0, binds to a random port

property.name: explore.start.on.demand
property.description: Determines the start-up of the CDAP Explore service (ad-hoc SQL queries); if false, the Explore service starts up when CDAP is started; if true, the Explore service will start upon the first query it receives

property.name: explore.writes.enabled
property.description: Determines if writing to a table through the CDAP Explore service (ad- hoc SQL queries) is enabled

property.name: hive.version.resolution.strategy
property.description: Determines how to behave when the Hive version on a cluster is an unsupported value. The default value of "auto.strict" will require that the Hive version matches a supported value; if Explore is enabled, CDAP Master will then not start if the Hive version is unsupported. Set to "auto.latest" to use the latest Hive version of CDAP modules available on the cluster with an unsupported Hive version. This property is ignored for supported versions of Hive or if Explore has been disabled by setting ${explore.enabled} to false.

property.name: hive.server2.jdbc.url
property.description: The JDBC URL for the HiveServer2 in the cluster. This is needed if user programs need HiveServer2 delegation token to interact with HiveServer2. It can remain empty if the delegation token is not required for the user programs.

property.name: app.boss.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service boss threads

property.name: app.connection.backlog
property.description: Maximum connection backlog of CDAP Master

property.name: app.exec.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service executor threads

property.name: app.worker.threads
property.description: Number of Netty service worker threads

property.name: kafka.seed.brokers
property.description: Comma-separated list of CDAP Kafka service brokers; for Distributed CDAP, replace with list of FQDN:port brokers

property.name: kafka.server.default.replication.factor
property.description: CDAP Kafka service replication factor; used to replicate Kafka messages across multiple machines to prevent data loss in the event of a hardware failure. The recommended setting is to run at least two CDAP Kafka servers. If you are running two CDAP Kafka servers, set this value to 2; otherwise, set it to the maximum number of tolerated machine failures plus one (assuming you have that number of machines).

property.name: kafka.server.host.name
property.description: CDAP Kafka service bind address

property.name: kafka.server.log.dirs
property.description: Comma-separated list of CDAP Kafka service log storage directories

property.name: kafka.server.log.flush.interval.messages
property.description: The interval length (in number of messages in the CDAP Kafka service) at which to force an fsync of data written to the log

property.name: kafka.server.log.retention.hours
property.description: The number of hours to keep a log file before deleting it; this is the time-to-live in the CDAP Kafka service, while a log is in-flight between the container and the CDAP log saver

property.name: kafka.server.num.partitions
property.description: Default number of partitions for a topic in the CDAP Kafka service

property.name: kafka.server.port
property.description: CDAP Kafka service bind port

property.name: kafka.server.zookeeper.connection.timeout.ms
property.description: Maximum time in milliseconds that the CDAP Kafka service will wait to establish a connection to ZooKeeper

property.name: kafka.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: CDAP Kafka service ZooKeeper namespace

property.name: kafka.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: CDAP Kafka service ZooKeeper quorum and namespace. If set, this will override the ZooKeeper quorum (set by ${zookeeper.quorum}) and the ZooKeeper namespace (set by ${kafka.zookeeper.namespace}) when setting up a connection to the Kafka service used by CDAP. If the same Kafka service ZooKeeper quorum and namespace are shared by multiple CDAP instances, each CDAP instance needs to distinguish its Kafka topics from those of other CDAP instances with unique values for ${log.kafka.topic} and ${metrics.topic.prefix}.

property.name: log.base.dir
property.description: In Distributed CDAP, the HDFS directory under which the system log pipeline saves log files

property.name: log.buffer.base.dir
property.description: Base directory for logs buffer

property.name: log.buffer.max.file.size.bytes
property.description: Maximum size in bytes of a log buffer file

property.name: log.buffer.server.bind.address
property.description: Log buffer HTTP service bind address

property.name: log.buffer.server.bind.port
property.description: Log buffer HTTP service bind port

property.name: app.program.log.appender.extensions.dir
property.description: Directory for log appender jars

property.name: app.program.log.appender.provider
property.description: Provider for log appender. The log appender provided by this provider will be loaded in each program container

property.name: log.buffer.recovery.batch.size
property.description: Log buffer recovery batch size in number of log events read. This will be used to recover logs in batches from log buffer upon log service restart

property.name: log.kafka.topic
property.description: Kafka topic name used to publish logs

property.name: log.tms.topic.prefix
property.description: TMS topic prefix used to publish logs

property.name: log.queue.size
property.description: The buffer size used in Log Appender

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.dir.permissions
property.description: Permissions used by the system log pipeline when creating directories

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.cleanup.interval.mins
property.description: Time in minutes between runs of the log cleanup thread

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.cleanup.batch.size
property.description: Batch size to clean up log metadata table

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.max.lifetime.ms
property.description: Maximum time span in milliseconds of a log file created by the system log pipeline

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.max.size.bytes
property.description: Maximum size in bytes of a log file created by the system log pipeline

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.permissions
property.description: Permissions used by the system log pipeline when creating files

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.retention.duration.days
property.description: Time in days a log file is retained

property.name: log.pipeline.cdap.file.sync.interval.bytes
property.description: Number of bytes for the sync interval setting of the Avro file written by the system log pipeline

property.name: log.process.pipeline.auto.buffer.ratio
property.description: The ratio of total memory used for determining processing pipeline buffer size. This property is only used if ${log.process.pipeline.buffer.size} is set to zero and this value should be greater than zero and less than one.

property.name: log.process.pipeline.buffer.size
property.description: The internal buffer size in bytes for each log processing pipeline. Setting it to zero means the system will determine it dynamically based on the container size as given by ${log.saver.container.memory.mb}.

property.name: log.process.pipeline.checkpoint.interval.ms
property.description: The time between log processing pipeline checkpoints in milliseconds

property.name: log.process.pipeline.config.dir
